children.label: UpperLimit
children.description: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'U' (higher than detection limit).

children.label: Version
children.description: A number or code associated with the product that identifies a particular release iteration.

children.label: Volume
children.description: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

children.label: Width
children.description: The measurement or extent of something from side to side.

children.label: shr.financial
children.description: The SHR Demographics domain contains definitions that describe basic characteristics of the person of record, such as name, address, and date of birth. Elements in the demographics domains are used for unique identification and patient matching.

children.label: Coverage
children.description: Health insurance coverage available (even if not used for payment for a given encounter).

children.label: InsuranceMemberId
children.description: Patient identifier at a healthcare provider, insurer, or other related organization.

children.label: PolicyHolder
children.description: Owner of the policy

children.label: shr.occupation
children.description: Patients or family member's work information.

children.label: CombatZoneHazardousDutyPeriod
children.description: A time period of combat zone duty. The time period does not necessarily correspond to the time period of a job; for example, a soldier may be deployed into a combat zone for 1 year out of 4 years of service.

children.label: CurrentEmploymentStatus
children.description: A persons current economic relationship to a job, for example, employed (currently working for compensation), unemployed (i.e., searching for work for compensation), or not in the labor force (e.g., student, homemaker, not seeking work). Employment status is not the same as classification of work. The relevant time is when the status was effective (not when the information was gathered). For example, if the status is 'retired' then the relevant time is the retirement date.

children.label: Employer
children.description: A person or organization that hires the services of another.

children.label: Industry
children.description: A particular form or branch of economic or commercial activity.

children.label: JobClassification
children.description: The classification of a person's job (one job) as defined by compensation and sector (e.g. paid, unpaid, self-employed, government, etc.). This is different from employment status: a person who is a volunteer (work classification) may have chosen not to be in the labor force (employment status).

children.label: JobDuty
children.description: A regular action performed at a single job.

children.label: MilitaryBranch
children.description: The branch of the US military that the subject has served.

children.label: MilitaryServiceDischargeStatus
children.description: How the subject was formally discharged from the US Military.

children.label: MilitaryServiceEra
children.description: The time period of US military service.

children.label: MilitaryServiceHistory
children.description: History of service in the US military.

children.label: MilitaryStatus
children.description: The current connection to the US military.

children.label: Occupation
children.description: A person's work or business

children.label: OccupationalDataSummaryPanel
children.description: Current and past activities for profit, wages, salary, or as a service to others.

children.label: OccupationalHazard
children.description: A hazard that is specific to a person's work or work environment for a single job and with which the person might come in contact. A hazard is a source of potential harm to an individual's physical or mental health (e.g., biological, chemical, physical, psychological, radiological).

children.label: PastOrPresentJob
children.description: A single job, past or present. The relevant time is the period the job was held.

children.label: ServiceConnectedDisability
children.description: Percentage disability resulting from US Military Service.

children.label: SupervisoryLevel
children.description: The amount of supervisory or management responsibilities of a person at one job. For military jobs, pay grade is used as a proxy because it can be interpreted across branches of service. A change in supervisory level is considered a new job.

children.label: TotalDuration
children.description: The total time spent on an activity, inclusive of all time intervals, whether continuous or interrupted.

children.label: UsualOccupation
children.description: The type of work a person has held for the longest amount of time during his or her life, regardless of the occupation currently held and regardless of whether or not it has been held for a continuous time.

children.label: WorkDaysPerWeek
children.description: The typical number of days worked in a week by a person at one job.

children.label: WorkHoursPerDay
children.description: The number of hours worked in a day or shift at one job by a person. For those working a split shift (divided into two parts that are separated by an interval longer than a normal rest period), it is the total of both periods of time in a shift.

children.label: WorkSchedule
children.description: A person's typical arrangement of working hours for one job.

children.label: shr.oncology
children.description: SHR implementation of ASCO requirements.

children.label: AverageCEP17SignalsPerCell
children.description: Average number CEP17 signals per cell (dual probe only)

children.label: AverageHER2SignalsPerCell
children.description: Average number of HER2 signals per cell

children.label: AverageStainingIntensity

concepts.label: Average intensity of positive staining neoplastic cells (observable entity) (http://snomed.info/sct:444775005)
concepts.display: Average intensity of positive staining neoplastic cells (observable entity)

children.description: The degree or magnitude of staining (nuclear positivity) across cells in the specimen.

children.label: BreastCancerDistantMetastasesClassification
children.description: The presence of distant metastases, based on criteria defined by the staging system being used.

children.label: BreastCancerHistologicGrade
children.description: The Elston Grade/Nottingham Score, representative of the aggressive potential of the tumor. Well differentiated cells (Grade 1) look similar to normal cells and are usually slow growing, while poorly differentiated cells (Grade 3) look very different than normal and are fast-growing.

children.label: BreastCancerPresenceStatement
children.description:
Diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.

The BreastCancerPresenceStatement is a subclass of ConditionPresenceStatement, which is a departure from CIMI. In CIMI, this would be a archetype of ClinicalStatement combining a BreastCancerConditionTopic with the ConditionPresenceContext. This would require definition of BreastCancerConditionTopic in the reference model, follwed by introduction of constraints on Value, Category, Stage, and MorphologyBehavior in the corresponding archetype.

children.label: BreastCancerPrimaryTumorClassification
children.description: The size and extent of the primary tumor, based on criteria defined by the staging system being used.

children.label: BreastCancerRegionalNodesClassification
children.description: The presence of metastases in regional lymph nodes, based on criteria defined by the staging system being used.

children.label: BreastCancerStage
children.description: The stage of a breast cancer. Different staging systems use different staging groups, so there are currently no terminology bindings associated with this class.

children.label: BreastSite
children.description: A body site specific to the breast structure.

children.label: BreastSpecimen
children.description: Specimen resulting from biopsy or excision of breast and surrounding tissue.

children.label: ColdIschemiaTime
children.description:
The time period between the chilling of a tissue or tissue sample and the time it is warmed.

CIMI Alignment: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, specimen processing is represented as a 'SpecimenProcessingPerformed' clinical statement, mapped to FHIR Procedure. However, specimen processing should actually map to Specimen.processing, part of the Specimen resource. It would be a difficult mapping exercise (beyond the scope of this IG) to express the mapping rule that any CIMI SpecimenProcessingPerformed clinical statement needs to mapped to FHIR by (1) finding the corresponding Specimen entity, and (2) mapping the content of (possibly multiple) SpecimenProcessingPerformed into the FHIR Specimen resource. To avoid this complexity, the breast cancer model expresses the cold ischemia time as an attribute of the BreastSpecimen rather than a separate procedure.

children.label: CompleteMembraneStainingPercent

concepts.label: Cells.HER2 uniform intense membrane staining/100 cells (http://loinc.org:85328-3)
concepts.display: Cells.HER2 uniform intense membrane staining/100 cells

children.description: Percentage of cells with uniform intense complete membrane staining.

children.label: DCISNuclearGrade
children.description: An evaluation of the size and shape of the nucleus in tumor cells and the percentage of tumor cells that are in the process of dividing or growing. Cancers with low nuclear grade grow and spread less quickly than cancers with high nuclear grade.

children.label: DistanceFromBreastSiteToNipple
children.description: Distance between the feature of interest (e.g., the tumor) and the nipple.

children.label: EstrogenReceptorStatus
children.description:
Estrogen receptor alpha is the predominant estrogen receptor expressed in breast tissue and is overexpressed in around 50% of breast carcinomas. ER status (positive=present or overexpressed; negative=absent) is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options.

We are seeking feedback if it is better to put the positive/negative status in Value or Interpretation. The current approach is that positive/negative designation is a value, even though that value is (in fact) an interpretation of evidence (NuclearPositivity and AverageStainingIntensity).

children.label: HER2byIHC
children.description: HER2 receptor status as determined by Immunohistochemistry (IHC).

code.label: HER2 Presence in Tissue by Immunoassay (http://loinc.org:72383-3)
code.display: HER2 Presence in Tissue by Immunoassay

children.label: HER2byISH
children.description: HER2 receptor status as determined by In Situ Hybridization (ISH).

code.label: HER2 [Presence] in Breast cancer specimen by FISH (http://loinc.org:85318-4)
code.display: HER2 [Presence] in Breast cancer specimen by FISH

children.label: HER2ReceptorStatus
children.description:
HER2 receptor status. HER2 is a member of the human epidermal growth factor receptor family of proteins and is encoded by the ERBB2 oncogene. HER2 is overexpressed in 20-30% of breast tumors, and is associated with an aggressive clinical course and poor prognosis. HER2 status (positive=present or overexpressed; negative=absent) is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options.

We are seeking feedback if it is better to put the positive/negative status in Value or Interpretation. The current approach is that positive/negative designation is a value, even though that value is (in fact) an interpretation of evidence from HER2 by IHC and/or HER2 by ISH tests, not a direct observation.

children.label: HER2toCEP17Ratio
children.description: HER2 to CEP17 Ratio (dual probe only)

children.label: MammaprintRecurrenceScore
children.description:
Breast cancer genomic signature assay for 10-year risk of distant recurrence score calculated by Mammaprint.

In the United States, MammaPrint can only be used on cancers that are stage I or stage II, invasive, smaller than 5 centimeters, and estrogen-receptor-positive or -negative. Scores range from -1.0 to +1.0, with scores less than 0 indicating high risk, and scores greater than 0 indicating low risk.

The is currently no LOINC code for Mammaprint test.

children.label: MitoticCountScore
children.description: How fast the tumor cells are growing and dividing, determined from the number of mitotic cells present. Scored 1 to 3, with 3 being the most mitotic cells. We are seeking feedback on the value of representing the mitotic rate as a value rather than coded ranges.

children.label: MorphologyBehavior
children.description: A description of the morphology and behavioral characteristics of the cancer.

children.label: NuclearPleomorphismScore
children.description: How large and varied the nuclei of the tumor cells are. Scored 1 to 3, with 3 being the most pleomorphism.

children.label: NuclearPositivity
children.description:
The percentage of cells that test (stain) positive for the presence of a receptor.

We are seeking feedback on whether nuclear positivity should be an exact percentage or a range of percentages. As currently defined, an exact nuclear positivity could be represented by a zero-width range, where the lower and upper bounds would be the same number.

children.label: OncotypeDxDCISRecurrenceScore
children.description:
The Oncotype DX test for DCIS (Ductal Carcinoma in Situ) breast cancer. Risk scores range from 0 to 100 with the following interpretations: 0-38: Low-Risk, 39-54: Intermediate-Risk, 55+: High-Risk.

No LOINC code currently exists for this test. We are seeking feedback on the value of separating OncotypeDx scores for DCIS and invasive breast carcinomas. Does it make more sense to report the OncotypeDx as a single score, regardless of the type of cancer?

children.label: OncotypeDxInvasiveRecurrenceScore
children.description:
The Oncotype DX test for invasive breast cancer examines the activity of 21 genes in a patients breast tumor tissue to provide personalized information for tailoring treatment based on the biology of their individual disease. The value from 0 to 100 indicates the estimated risk of recurrence, with the highest risk indicated by a score greater than 31.

No LOINC code currently exists for this test. We are seeking feedback on the value of separating OncotypeDx scores for DCIS and invasive breast carcinomas. Does it make more sense to report the OncotypeDx as a single score, regardless of the type of cancer?

children.label: ProgesteroneReceptorStatus
children.description:
Progesterone receptor status is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options. The value is the percentage of cells that test (stain) positive for the presence of a receptor. The interpretation of positive or negative (found in the interpretation property) is based on the staining percentage, and may take into account the staining intensity.

Based on discussion with Cancer Interoperability Group subject matter experts, there was insufficient rationale to include the following components in the data model: StainingControl, PrimaryAntibody, Allred Score (both total and component scores). We are seeking feedback on whether or not those components should be included in this model.

We are seeking feedback if it is better to put the positive/negative status in Value or Interpretation. The current approach is that positive/negative designation is a value, even though that value is (in fact) an interpretation of evidence (NuclearPositivity and AverageStainingIntensity).

children.label: ProsignaRecurrenceScore
children.description:
Breast cancer genomic signature assay for 10-year risk of distant recurrence score calculated by Prosigna.

The Prosigna Score is reported on a 0 -100 scale (referred to as ROR Score or Risk of Recurrence Score in the literature), which is correlated with the probability of distant recurrence at ten years for post-menopausal women with hormone receptor positive, early stage breast cancer.

children.label: StageSuffix
children.description: A suffix used in conjuction with certain breast cancer stages, based on criteria defined by the staging system being used.

children.label: StageTimingPrefix
children.description: Indicates when the staging was done, in terms of treatment landmarks.

children.label: TubuleFormationScore
children.description: A comparison between structures formed by the tumor cells and those formed by normal cells. Scored 1 to 3 with 3 being the most abnormal.

children.label: shr.research
children.description: The SHR research domain contains definitions related to the clinical trials and research studies.

children.label: Enrollment
children.description: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.

children.label: Jurisdiction
children.description: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility for the conduct of the study.

children.label: PrincipalInvestigator
children.description: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.

children.label: ResearchSubject
children.description: Record of a subject's enrollment and participation in a research study.

children.label: Sponsor
children.description: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.

children.label: Study
children.description: A clinical trial or similar research study. Reference: list of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

children.label: StudyArm
children.description: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

children.label: TerminationReason
children.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

children.label: Mild Adverse Event. Transient or mild discomfort, no limitaion in activity; no medical intervention or therapy required

code.label: Mild Adverse Event. Transient or mild discomfort, no limitaion in activity; no medical intervention or therapy required

children.label: Moderate Adverse Event. Daily activity is affected moderately; some assistance might be needed; no or minimal medical intervention/therapy required.

code.label: Moderate Adverse Event. Daily activity is affected moderately; some assistance might be needed; no or minimal medical intervention/therapy required.

children.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

code.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

children.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

code.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

children.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

code.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

children.label: AttributionCategoryVS
children.description: Whether the adverse event is attributed to a treatment, course of the disease, medical error, unrelated to either, or unknown.

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to an intervention or treatment.

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to an intervention or treatment.

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to the course of the disease

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to the course of the disease

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to a medical error

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to a medical error

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to an cause unrelated to the treatment, disease, or medical error.

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to an cause unrelated to the treatment, disease, or medical error.

children.label: The causal category of the adverse event is unknown

code.label: The causal category of the adverse event is unknown

children.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

code.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

children.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

code.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

children.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

code.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

children.label: ExceptionValueVS
children.description: Reasons that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing. Includes all codes from 	http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/data-absent-reason version 3.3.0 and additional codes covering other missing value circumstances.

children.label: Unknown: The value is not known.

code.label: Unknown: The value is not known.

children.label: Asked But Unknown: The source human does not know the value.

code.label: Asked But Unknown: The source human does not know the value.

children.label: Temporarily Unknown: There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known.

code.label: Temporarily Unknown: There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known.

children.label: Not Asked: The workflow didn't lead to this value being known.

code.label: Not Asked: The workflow didn't lead to this value being known.

children.label: Asked But Declined: The source was asked but declined to answer.

code.label: Asked But Declined: The source was asked but declined to answer.

children.label: Masked: The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons.

code.label: Masked: The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons.

children.label: Not Applicable: There is no proper value for this element (e.g. last menstrual period for a male)

code.label: Not Applicable: There is no proper value for this element (e.g. last menstrual period for a male)

children.label: Unsupported: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element.

code.label: Unsupported: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element.

children.label: As Text: The content of the data is represented in the resource narrative.

code.label: As Text: The content of the data is represented in the resource narrative.

children.label: Error: Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available.

code.label: Error: Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available.

children.label: Not a Number (NaN): The numeric value is undefined or unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

code.label: Not a Number (NaN): The numeric value is undefined or unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

children.label: Negative Infinity (NINF): The numeric value is excessively low and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

code.label: Negative Infinity (NINF): The numeric value is excessively low and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

children.label: Positive Infinity (PINF): The numeric value is excessively high and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

code.label: Positive Infinity (PINF): The numeric value is excessively high and unrepresentable due to a floating point processing error.

children.label: Not Performed: The value is not available because the observation procedure  (test, etc.) was not performed.

code.label: Not Performed: The value is not available because the observation procedure  (test, etc.) was not performed.

children.label: Not Permitted: The value is not permitted in this context (e.g. due to profiles, or the base data types)

code.label: Not Permitted: The value is not permitted in this context (e.g. due to profiles, or the base data types)

children.label: The value cannot be determined, for some unspecified reason.

code.label: The value cannot be determined, for some unspecified reason.

children.label: The reason the information is not present is not known.

code.label: The reason the information is not present is not known.

children.label: The answer is missing because nothing of a type of thing is known to exists, e.g., the siblings of an only child. Also use this code to represent a 'none of the above' answer

code.label: The answer is missing because nothing of a type of thing is known to exists, e.g., the siblings of an only child. Also use this code to represent a 'none of the above' answer

children.label: Missing due to a problem collecting, identifying, or locating the specimen, including patient refusal or unable to provide specimen

code.label: Missing due to a problem collecting, identifying, or locating the specimen, including patient refusal or unable to provide specimen

children.label: Missing due to a problem with the specimen, e.g. inadequate specimen, contamination, clotting, improper tube type, improper storage, too small, etc.

code.label: Missing due to a problem with the specimen, e.g. inadequate specimen, contamination, clotting, improper tube type, improper storage, too small, etc.

children.label: PresenceContextVS
children.description: A code describing whether the finding in question is present, possible, suspected, etc.

children.label: AbsenceContextVS
children.description: A code describing whether the finding is question is absent, unknown, or not suspected.

children.label: AtRiskContextVS
children.description: A code describing the sense in which the subject has risk of a hypothetical (future) finding. At present, this value set contains only one code, but it is presented as a value set to allow for more nuanced meanings in the future.

children.label: ExpectationContextVS
children.description: A code describing the sense in which a finding is expected.

children.label: GoalContextVS
children.description: A code describing the sense in which a finding is a goal or objective.

children.label: DeltaFlagVS
children.description: Indicators for degree of change (delta) from the last or previous measurement.

children.label: AnatomicalLocationVS
children.description: Codes that describe normal and pathologic anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

children.label: AnatomicalDirectionVS
children.description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Codes are from NCI

children.label: ANTERIOR Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.

code.label: ANTERIOR Denoting the front portion of the body or a structure.

children.label: APICAL Relating to or located at the apex.

code.label: APICAL Relating to or located at the apex.

children.label: BASAL Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.

code.label: BASAL Relating to or located at the lowest portion of a structure.

children.label: CAUDAL Toward the tail in a body.

code.label: CAUDAL Toward the tail in a body.

children.label: CENTRAL A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.

code.label: CENTRAL A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.

children.label: CRANIAL Toward the head in a body.

children.description: The nuclear grade describes how closely the nuclei of cancer cells look like the nuclei of normal breast cells. children.label: Recurrence Score lower than 18: The cancer has a low risk of recurrence. The benefit of chemotherapy is likely to be small and will not outweigh the risks of side effects. (http://standardhealthrecord.org/shr/oncology/cs/OncotypeDxInvasiveRiskScoreInterpretationCS:low_risk)
